verses.text: 斥責雅各和猶大的罪「以法蓮吃風，整天追趕東風，增添虛謊和強暴。他們與亞述結盟，又給埃及送油。」

words.note: Common in general, but has strong biblical significance here.

verses.text: 耶和華與猶大爭辯；他必照雅各所行的懲罰他，按他所作的報應他。

words.note: Indicates the object of the following verb, forming a noun phrase.
Indicates the object of the following verb, forming a noun phrase.

verses.text: 他在母腹中抓住他哥哥的腳跟，壯年的時候又與 神角力。

words.note: Indicates a firm grasp or successful completion of action.
Refers to the one true God, functioning as a proper noun.

verses.text: 他與天使角力，並且得勝；他哀哭，向他求恩。他在伯特利遇見 神， 神在那裡對他說話。

words.note: Refers to the one true God, functioning as a proper noun.
Refers to the one true God, functioning as a proper noun.

verses.text: 耶和華是萬軍的 神，耶和華是他的名號。

words.note: Refers to the one true God, functioning as a proper noun.

verses.text: 所以你要靠著你的 神歸回，謹守忠信和公平，常常等候你的 神。

words.note: The space before 神 (Shén) is often used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
The space before 神 (Shén) is often used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.

verses.text: 斥責以法蓮的罪行及其重罰以色列是個商人，手裡拿著詭詐的天平，喜愛欺壓別人。

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly balance' or 'level scales'.

verses.text: 以法蓮說：「我成了富翁，我為自己發了財；在我所有的收益中，人不能找出我有甚麼罪孽，可算為罪惡的。」

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a nominalized clause or emphasizes the adjective.

verses.text: 「自從你出埃及地以來，我就是耶和華你的 神；我必使你再住在帳棚裡，像在節日的日子一樣，

words.note: Used as a suffix to a time phrase to mean 'since (then)'.
The space before 神 (Shén) is often used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
Refers to religious feasts like the Feast of Tabernacles.

verses.text: 我曾對先知說話，加添許多異象；又藉先知說比喻。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 在基列仍有罪孽，他們實在是沒有價值的。他們在吉甲獻牛犢為祭，他們的祭壇好像田間犁溝中的石堆。」

words.note: Often used for serious moral transgressions.
Emphasizes truth or reality.
Often implies offering to a deity or superior.
Young cattle, often used for sacrifice.
Specific agricultural term.

verses.text: 從前雅各逃到亞蘭地，以色列為得妻子而作工，為得妻子而替人放羊。

words.note: Refers to ancient Syria.
Here referring to Jacob.
Often used in a general sense of performing work.

verses.text: 後來，耶和華藉著一位先知把以色列從埃及領上來，也藉著一位先知，以色列得蒙看顧。

words.note: The covenant name of God.
One who speaks for God.
Refers to the nation of Israel.
Implies leading upwards or to a higher place.
One who speaks for God.
Often used for receiving favor or blessing.
Implies protection and provision.

verses.text: 以法蓮大大地惹了主的烈怒，所以，他的主把他流人血的罪歸到他身上，把他當受的羞辱歸給他。

words.note: A prominent tribe of Israel.
Reduplication of '大' (big) for emphasis.
Marks completed action.
Refers to God.
Strong, intense anger.
Refers to God.
Describes the nature of the sin.
Assign blame or responsibility.
Figurative for 'upon him' or 'to him'.
Indicates something justly due or merited.
Similar to 歸到 but often implies giving back or assigning to.
